intro: Dorstenia phillipsiae, commonly known as the Phillips' zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Dorstenia phillipsiae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and ease of care.
